newsitem.title: USA: Core says in talks for possible sale of company.
newsitem.headline: Core says in talks for possible sale of company.

text.p: Core Industries Inc. Monday reported higher profits and said it was in talks with a third party related to the possible sale of the fluid control, testing and farm equipment company.
Bloomfield Hills, Mich.-based Core said it made the statement in response to inquiries concerning increases in the price of its common stock.
Core stock was up $1 at $20.75, a new 52-week high, on the New York Stock Exchange in afternoon trading.
Core did not say if the discussions were in response to an unsolicited offer or if the talks had been initiated by the company.
A company spokesman declined to comment further.
Core said its net earnings rose 31 percent to $4.7 million, or 44 cents per share, for its fiscal third quarter ended May 31 from $3.6 million, or 34 cents a share, a year earlier.
Sales rose 21 percent to $76.6 million from $63.1 million, the company said.
